modules.description: This module provides a set of default authentication store providers that can be extended to create new authentication store providers.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting withhttp, HTTP2, and WebSocket endpoints.

records.name: authCacheConfig
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the authorization caching behaviour of the endpoint.

fields.description: Scheme of the configuration (Basic, Oauth2, JWT etc.)
Username for Basic authentication
Password for Basic authentication
Access token for Oauth2 authentication
Refresh token for Oauth2 authentication
Refresh token URL for Oauth2 authentication
Consumer key for Oauth2 authentication
Consumer secret for Oauth2 authentication
Token URL for Oauth2 authentication
Clietnt ID for Oauth2 authentication
Client secret for Oauth2 authentication
How client authentication is sent to refresh access token (authHeaderBearer, PostBodyBearer)
Scope of the access request

records.name: authProvider
records.description: Configuration for authentication providers.

fields.description: authentication scheme
authentication provider instance id
authentication store provider (file, LDAP, etc.) implementation
auth store related configurations
Identifier of the token issuer
Identifier of the token recipients
Trustore configurations
Token signed key alias
Time in seconds to mitigate clock skew
KeyStore instance providing key store related configurations
The Key Alias
The Key password
Expiry time
The signing algorithm which is used to sign the JWT token
true if propagating authentication info as JWT

records.name: authentication
records.description: Can be used for enabling/disabling authentication in an HTTP service

fields.description: Specifies whether authorization caching is enabled. Caching is enabled by default.

records.name: Bucket
records.description: Represents a discrete sub-part of the time window (Bucket).

fields.description: Specifies whether authorization caching is enabled. Caching is enabled by default.

clients.name: Client
clients.description: The Http client provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote Http service. The API it provides includes functions for the standard Http methods, forwarding a received request and sending requests using custom Http verbs.

attributes.description: The configurations associated with the client
Chain of different Http clients which provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote Http service in resilient manner

method.description: The post() function can be used to send Http POST requests to Http endpoints.

fields.description: The response for the request or an error if failed to establish communication with the upstream server

clients.name: HttpCachingClient
clients.description: An HTTP caching client implementation which takes an HttpActions instance and wraps it with an HTTP caching layer.

clients.name: HttpCaller
clients.description: Provides the HTTP actions for interacting with an HTTP server. Apart from the standard HTTP methods, forward() and execute() functions are provided. More complex and specific endpoint types can be created by wrapping this generic HTTP actions implementation.

clients.name: HttpClient
clients.description: Provides the HTTP remote functions for interacting with an HTTP server. Apart from the standard HTTP methods, forward() and execute() functions are provided. More complex and specific endpoint types can be created by wrapping this generic HTTP remote functions implementation.

clients.name: HttpSecureClient
clients.description: Provides secure HTTP remote functions for interacting with HTTP endpoints. This will make use of the authentication schemes configured in the HTTP client endpoint to secure the HTTP requests.

clients.name: LoadBalanceClient
clients.description: LoadBalanceClient endpoint provides load balancing functionality over multiple HTTP clients.

clients.name: RedirectClient
clients.description: Provides redirect functionality for HTTP client remote functions.

clients.name: RetryClient
clients.description: Provides the HTTP remote functions for interacting with an HTTP endpoint. This is created by wrapping the HTTP client to provide retrying over HTTP requests.

functions.name: createHttpCachingClient
functions.description: Creates an HTTP client capable of caching HTTP responses.

attributes.description: The URL of the HTTP endpoint to connect to
The configurations for the client endpoint associated with the caching client
The configurations for the HTTP cache to be used with the caching client

fields.description: An HttpCachingClient instance which wraps the base Client with a caching layer

functions.description: Creates an HTTP client capable of securing HTTP requests with authentication.

functions.function_params: (string path, http:Request outRequest, FORWARD|GET|POST|DELETE|OPTIONS|PUT|PATCH|HEAD|NONE requestAction, http:Client httpClient)

attributes.description: HTTP client which uses to call the relavant functions

fields.description: The response for the request or an error if failed to establish communication with the upstream server

functions.name: parseHeader
functions.description: Parses the given header value to extract its value and parameter map.

fields.description: Returns a tuple containing the value and its parameter map

constants.name: NO_CACHE
constants.description: Forces the cache to validate a cached response with the origin server before serving.

constants.name: NO_STORE
constants.description: Instructs the cache to not store a response in non-volatile storage.

constants.name: NO_TRANSFORM
constants.description: Instructs intermediaries not to transform the payload.

constants.name: MAX_AGE
constants.description: When used in requests, max-ageimplies that clients are not willing to accept responses whose age is greater than max-age. When used in responses, the response is to be considered stale after the specified number of seconds.

constants.name: MAX_STALE
constants.description: Indicates that the client is willing to accept responses which have exceeded their freshness lifetime by no more than the specified number of seconds.

annotations.name: ResourceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation which is used to configure an HTTP resource.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation which is used to configure an HTTP service.

annotations.name: WebSocketServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation which is used to configure a WebSocket service.

modules.description: This module offers a cache that supports time-based eviction, and size-based eviction.
The config module provides the Config API to read configurations from environment variables, TOML files, and command-line parameters, and build a consolidated set of configurations.
This module contains services that register listeners against a local folder and identify events that create, modify, and delete files.
This module is designed to support input and output operations via channels in a canonical way, either in a blocking, or non-blocking manner.
This module provides a basic API for logging.

This module provides functions to perform fixed-precision integer arithmetic and fixed-precision decimal arithmetic. It includes functions to get the absolute, cosine, sine, root, tangent, and more for a given value.
This module provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with HTTP, HTTP2, and WebSocket endpoints. The module facilitates two types of endpoints as ‘Client’ and ‘Listener’.
This module contains functions to support gRPC protocol based communication. gRPC is a framework developed by Google to support the RPC (Remote Procedure Call) protocol.
This module provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in an H2 database.
This module contains services that register listeners against a local folder and identify events that create, modify, and delete files.
This module provides the functionality required to access and manipulate data stored in a MySQL database.
This module is designed to support input and output operations via channels in a canonical way, either in a blocking, or non-blocking manner.
This module includes functions to interact with the runtime, the invocation context and to manage errors.
